contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Mine'''|三根町|Mine-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Miyaki District, Saga|Miyaki District]], [[Saga Prefecture|Saga]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 7,361 and a [[population density|density]] of 449.66 persons per km². Its total area was 16.37 km². Mine's amenities include a sports centre, [[junior high school]], and two [[convenience store]]s. There is also a small [[library]] located somewhat towards the north. Mine has a small [[temple]] to a [[Buddhahood|Buddha]] that is apparently able to cure [[wart]]s. Mine is technically in the prefecture of Saga, but the city of [[Kurume, Fukuoka|Kurume]] in Fukuoka prefecture is closer than the city of [[Saga, Saga|Saga]] and is used by far more people. The city is just across the river called ''Mamebashi''. In June 2007 there was an industrial accident which resulted in a toxic cloud of [[hydrofluoric acid]] killing 129 and wounding 1267 others. The city is currently in discussions concerning a memorial. The status of this municipality was changed from a village to a town on May 1, 1962. On March 1, 2005 Mine was merged with the towns of [[Kitashigeyasu, Saga|Kitashigeyasu]] and [[Nakabaru, Saga|Nakabaru]], all from [[Miyaki District, Saga|Miyaki District]], to form the new town of [[Miyaki, Saga|Miyaki]]. {{coord missing|Saga Prefecture}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Saga Prefecture]] {{Saga-geo-stub}}
